title: anonymousminer
author: anonymousminer
content: Up for auction today are 9 different Fully Functioning Block Erupters!!First a little history about the Block Erupters for those unfamiliar with these items.  Originally 12 "Emerald" Block Erupters were put out as a proof of concept.  These are the absolute rarest of the rare when it comes to these little pieces of Bitcoin history.  Unfortunately there are none of those available here today.... however there are some RARE ones to offer up!After the "Emeralds" proved the concept the Sapphire Collection was released.  They were released in 2 batches.  Batch 1 had 4 different faceplates.  Batch 2 had 7 different faceplates.  The original sale price was 1.99BTC per unit and a minimum order of 300 units!  ....and yes that's 597BTC for the minimum order!      During my research I found that the early calculations for ROI on these were about 163 days and seemed to hold under 200 days until Batch 2 FLOODED the market.  A rarity statement about the batches:"Batch 1 - Block Erupters USBs were all flat colors:- Silver with an orange bitcoin logo (First ones to be shipped out) (RARE!)- Black (COMMON)- Yellowish-Orange (RARE!)- Red (COMMON)Batch 2 - Block Erupter USBs had regulatory markings on the aluminum heat sinks and had slightly better surface processing done on them. While they were the same hash rate, they did have a few minor hardware improvements. These came in 7 different variations:- Black (COMMON)- Blue (COMMON)- Red (COMMON)- Silver (COMMON)- Gold (SEMI-RARE)- Blue with surface concentric circle effect (SEMI-RARE)- Red with surface concentric circle effect (SEMI-RARE)"With that being said.... today the following ones available for auction:From Batch 1Lot 1 - Silver with an orange bitcoin logo (First ones to be shipped out) (RARE!)Lot 2 - Black (COMMON)Lot 3 - Yellowish-Orange (RARE!)Lot 4 - Red (COMMON)Lot 5 - This one is a Black (ERROR)(It had the faceplate installed upside down. Some of these errors made it out like this, but there are no figures on how many)From Batch 2Lot 6 - Blue (COMMON)Lot 7 - Red (COMMON)Lot 8 - Silver (COMMON)Lot 9 - Gold (SEMI-RARE)Lots 1, 2, 3 and 4Lots 1, 2, 3 and 4Lot 5Lot 5Lots 6, 7, 8 and 9Lots 6, 7, 8 and 9Random pic from testingRandom pic from testingProof they are not just lighting up, but actually hashingSTARTING BID PER LOT: 0.0005BTCMINIMUM BID INCREMENT PER LOT: 0.0001BTCPlease limit bids to ONLY 4 decimal placesEND TIME: NOVEMBER 9th, 2023, 17:00:00 ESTPayment due within 24 hours of auction end!!SNIPE: Any bid made in last 5 minutes PER LOT will extend the auction 5 minutes beyond the ending time PER LOT.If within those 5 extended minutes, a new bid is made, 5 minutes will be added to the auction from the time of that bid PER LOT.PAYMENT: bc1qlylhtyh3q0chdf6e4qa87u9647ddxmxcge0f0vSHIPPING: Based on location and preferenceOWNER: NOT DISCLOSED** Please only pay the payment address above when final bids are posted by me.  I will not contact you away from this site for any reason. **

comments.author: krogothmanhattan
comments.body: Lot 1: 0.0010BTC   Nice collection you have there...I collect these myself but not sure what I have and what I don't at the moment.   I am sure I do not have the elusive green emerald ones for sure!

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.created_time: November 06, 2023, 04:53:02 PMLast edit: November 07, 2023, 01:45:00 AM by MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: nice auction! if didnt have a bunch of these coming already would be in on this auction - great piece of history.nvm none coming lol will be watching auction.

comments.author: anonymousminer
comments.body: You see a lot of these not working or they just light up so the fact that they are all hashing adds to their collectability.... or run them.... in the past year 2 blocks have been hit by solo stick miners so maybe the math will be in your favor. Appreciate you two getting us started.  Good luck.Current high bids:Quote from: krogothmanhattan on November 06, 2023, 04:49:43 PMLot 1: 0.0010BTCQuote from: Cyrus on November 06, 2023, 04:49:10 PMLot 2: 0.0005BTCLot 3: 0.0005BTCLot 4: 0.0005BTCLot 5: 0.0005BTCLot 6: 0.0005BTCLot 7: 0.0005BTCLot 8: 0.0005BTCLot 9: 0.0005BTC

comments.author: minerjones
comments.body: Interesting fact about USB solo miners:It looks like 4 blocks have actually been hit by solo stick miners in the last 2 years per Decrypt.https://decrypt.co/119717/solo-bitcoin-miner-solves-block-with-hash-rate-of-just-10-th-s-beating-extremely-unlikely-oddsGood luck with the auction!
